author: Ronald Le
title: A DEX aggregator on Cardano
description: There is a shortage of DEXs, Dapps building on Cardano's Ecosystems

assessments.note: There are already proposals for a DEX which a committed team behind it. It would help if you include your position why we should found your dex. The statment that there's a shortage of DEX in our ecosystem ist not true.

The proposal is for a whole suite of off chain software packages which will work with centralized institutions, it is unclear how this relates to a decentralized finance and appears to be the opposite of DeFi. The propsal's slide deck doesn't mention where the decentralized exchange would fit within the permissioned ecosystem that Instamo is developing with KYC at every step. In addition, cross border payments are available right now using ADA, the problem this solves isn't clear.
Proposer has asked for the entire fund, with no detailed plan. Please explain how this addresses the goal with a detailed plan and explanation.

The declaration of the problem and solution make sense and are aligned with the challenge, but there is no information in the business plan (attached file) related to a DEX, I recommend that the proposer clarify this aspect.

In the plan presented in the attached file there is no mention of the terms "Dex", "Catalyst" or "Cardano".

No specific proposal is provided by "A DEX aggregator". While Instamo may or may not be an effective DEX aggregator neither the Catalyst proposal nor the linked slide deck provide any information regarding how Istamo will be integrated with and provide services for the Cardano ecosystem.

The proposal does not adresses this challenge, at least, in the way it is presented at the moment.
It looks like the website is about an app building bridges between businesses and payments / investments gateway.
I feel like this proposal should be in the DApps challenge.

[UPDATE]: The exact same proposal is also in the Dapps challenge.

It would help to add more information about the Team behind this proposal. A DEX is a complicated undertaking which needs quite a bit of work. If you already did a DEX 3 years ago why is the name of the DEX not in the proposal. Is it still alive, what about the code?

There is no roadmap or budget in the proposal.

If there is already a working product, the budget of 250k is unfortunately to much.

The team has relevant experience in this financial services world, however it isn't clear how the funding from catalyst will be used while they seek to raise over $800k. There is a risk that even if funded with catalyst that the remaining funds won't be raised and the project would fail.
requesting the entire amount of funds and having little information available seems unreliable
There is no detailed information on how the DEX aggregator will work. The team doesn't seem to have a background in blockchian development.
No plan. No evidence of experience. Asking for 250,000, the entire fund budget. Unlikely to be successfully delivered.

There is no plan in the description.

There is an attachment file with many details about a business plan but the proposal described in this business plan is for a crossborder payment system and has nothing to do with a crosschain DEX. I recommend that the proposer clarify the purpose of the proposal and what the relation of the plan described in the attachment file with a DEX and this challenge.

There is a large difference between a Dex and a crosschain DEX aggregator. A Dex by itself is a DAPP that has a relatively large complexity, a  Cross Chain  DEX aggregator is a much more complex project.

One of the few projects that develops a  Cross Chain DEX, Thorchain took more than 2 years to launch their mainnet and even after launch still has few pairs, the point is that getting a bridge cross chain efficiently was only possible through recently with the AMM model, because atomic swaps do not allow relevant liquidity.

My recommendation is that if the team intends to develop a project of such complexity, it should submit a proposal with sufficient plan and details. The community can help with feedback and if it is necessary help the team can look for people or developers interested in the Discord channel.
No plan is provided. While the Instamo slide deck is informative, this is an overview of Instamo rather than a proposal for how the Catalyst funds will be utilized.

First, the proposer claim to have a couple years experience in Dexs and in making partnership & integration with Financial institutions. I can't access the instamo employees linkedin profiles witheout being part of their "network". 
Still, the proposer's name is matching with the one quoted on instamo website, and, he do have a linkedin profile. It would be great to have those links written down in the proposition so the CAs don't have to search for too long.

The plan: 
https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/17VYtHD7nfxCyDJ9O-E2sV8rzyd61tb3ByTttbNjJA_0/edit?ts=60174d60#slide=id.gb92a66b0cc_0_145

I must say it is interesting, but some pages are a little bit too blurry, like some bad copy-past. It felt like it when i scrolled down to read more deeply about the proposal.
It could be more trustworhty, as we are all very aware of internet scammers. No offense to the proposers, it is just a fact.
I would recommend to re-do this proposal and add way more information. Again, no roadmap, risk assessment or anything.

The proposal doesn't show how the Cardano's DeFi ecosystem would grow as a result of this proposed project. Cardano isn't mentioned at all in the proposal's slide deck, and it isn't clear how cardano would be used to power instamo.
their link does not seem very related to the proposal.
There is no roadmap or milestones outline that would help measure the progress of the proposal.
Please provide more information. Detailed plan, budget breakdown, milestones, KPI's etc.

The described business plan presented in the attachment file has no relation to a DEX.

There is no information in the business plan related to Catalyst or informations that justify the requested budget.
No information is provided regarding the objectives or tasks to be assessed. There is no way to audit the success, since there is no proposal.

There are many informations to audit the progress of this proposal, but it looks like a real business plan with many partners, and, as it is written in page 46 of the google doc: "We are looking to raise  $840,000".

That being said, how catalyst community's money will be implemented in your budget?
Why the Cardano ecosystem would need a centralized company to offer theses kinds of services?
I can't see many benefits for the community at this moment.
